sentences.english: In reality, short-selling is far from being financial black magic.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，空頭並非金融巫婆。

sentences.english: There's no improbity force from witch and rabbi either.
sentences.chinese: 也沒有巫婆和法師的邪惡勢力。

sentences.english: Then the witch placed her cauldron on the fire, to prepare the magic draught.
sentences.chinese: 巫婆於是就把藥罐準備好，來煎這服富有魔力的藥了。

sentences.english: The price would be high as the witch was famous for the exorbitant prices she charged.
sentences.chinese: 但是，代價會很高，老巫婆正是因爲要價過高而出名。

sentences.english: I shouldn't have let you watch “The Witch”.
Early Europeans believed in evil spirits, witches, ghosts and trolls.
sentences.chinese: 早期歐洲人相信惡鬼，巫婆，鬼，巨魔。

sentences.english: Gretel, weeping bitterly, was obliged to do as she was told.
sentences.chinese: 格萊特傷心地哭了，但她被迫照着巫婆的話去做。

sentences.english: Even witches appreciate what they bring to a boiling cauldron.
sentences.chinese: 就連巫婆都喜歡沸騰着的冒着氣泡的大鍋。

sentences.english: The angered witch got up and went to Clemencia's bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 巫婆的憤怒起身前往克萊門的臥室。

sentences.english: The townsmen grabbed their guns and their pitchforks and ran toward the witch.
sentences.chinese: 市民劫掠了他們的槍和他們的乾草叉並且跑了往巫婆。

sentences.english: Newfoundlanders know it as the "Old Hag."
sentences.chinese: 紐芬蘭人稱其爲“老巫婆”。

sentences.english: You lose the the witch and her two little brats in one swoops .
sentences.chinese: 你忽然間就可以見不到一個巫婆和她的兩個小鬼了。

sentences.english: So the king to hold the girl on the horse, the old witch, only then way to tell the king.
sentences.chinese: 等國王把姑娘抱上了馬，老巫婆才把路告訴國王。

sentences.english: The witch took the necessary hair of Snow White while she was sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 巫婆在她睡著時取了一根白雪公主的頭髮。

sentences.english: "I know what you want, " said the sea witch;
sentences.chinese: “我知道你是來求什麼的，”海的巫婆說。

sentences.english: Because this is not an old's heart, so witches can not die now.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這是一顆不老的心，所以巫婆現在不能死。

definition: ghost of a person who died by hanging/hanged person/(coll.) inchworm/hangman (word game)
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
queer uncle, referring to a young to middle-aged male pedophile (Internet slang)
